meanings.definition: The top or highest part of something.
meanings.sent1: The apex of the mountain was covered in snow.
meanings.sent2: The climber reached the apex of the peak after a long journey.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the cake's apex was adorned with a sparkly candle.
meanings.sent4: Her performance reached the apex of perfection, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The apex of the tree towered over the rest of the forest, casting a long shadow.

meanings.sent1: The sun reached its apex in the sky at noon.
meanings.sent2: The eagle soared to the apex of the mountain, scanning the landscape below.
meanings.sent3: The apex of the roller coaster provided an exhilarating thrill.
meanings.sent4: His excitement reached its apex when he won the championship.
meanings.sent5: The apex of her career was when she received the prestigious award.

meanings.definition: The culmination or highest point of something.
meanings.sent1: The apex of their relationship was their dream wedding.
meanings.sent2: The apex of the movie was the unexpected plot twist.
meanings.sent3: The apex of the game was when the underdog team scored the winning goal.
meanings.sent4: Her joy reached its apex when she held her newborn baby for the first time.
meanings.sent5: The apex of the concert was the encore performance that left the crowd cheering for more.
